La capacidad antioxidante de la cepa bacteriana se estableci usando el ensayo ABTS (cido 2,2'-azino-bis(cido 3-etilbenzotiazolina-6-sulfnico)) bien conocido.The ability of compositions comprising bacterial strains according to the invention to alter antioxidant capacity. The antioxidant capacity of the bacterial strain was established using the well-known ABTS (2,2'-azino-bis(3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulfonic acid)) assay.

Cepa bacterianabacterial strain

Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029 Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029

MtodoMethod

Se recogieron y centrifugaron clulas bacterianas (106 o ms). Se resuspendieron en tampn de ensayo (usando tres veces el volumen del sedimento). La suspensin se sonic en hielo durante 5 minutos y luego se centrifug a 12.000 x g durante 10 minutos. El sobrenadante se elimin y se midi usando el kit de ensayo ABTS producido por Sigma Aldrich (cdigo CS0790), de acuerdo con las instrucciones del fabricante.Bacterial cells (10 6 or more) were collected and centrifuged. They were resuspended in assay buffer (using three times the pellet volume). The suspension was sonicated on ice for 5 minutes and then centrifuged at 12,000 x g for 10 minutes. The supernatant was removed and measured using the ABTS assay kit produced by Sigma Aldrich (code CS0790), according to the manufacturer's instructions.

ResultadosResults

Los resultados de estos experimentos se muestran en la Figura 7. La Figura 7 muestra que MRx0029 tiene una capacidad antioxidante de aproximadamente 2 mM en comparacin con Trolox.The results of these experiments are shown in Figure 7. Figure 7 shows that MRx0029 has an antioxidant capacity of approximately 2 mM compared to Trolox.

Ejemplo 5 - Eficacia de los inculos bacterianos para alterar los niveles de peroxidacin lipdica Example 5 - Efficacy of Bacterial Inoculums to Alter Lipid Peroxidation Levels ResumenSummary

Se investig la capacidad de las composiciones que comprenden cepas bacterianas de acuerdo con la invencin para alterar los niveles de peroxidacin lipdica. Se us el ensayo de sustancias reactivas tiobarbitricas (TBAR) para medir los subproductos de la peroxidacin lipdica.The ability of compositions comprising bacterial strains according to the invention to alter lipid peroxidation levels was investigated. The thiobarbiturate reactive substance assay (TBAR) was used to measure lipid peroxidation byproducts.

Material y mtodosMaterial and methods

Cepa bacterianabacterial strain

Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029 Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029

MtodoMethod

Se recogieron y centrifugaron clulas bacterianas (106 o ms), se realiz un paso de lavado con solucin salina isotnica antes de volver a suspender el sedimento en tampn de ensayo de cloruro de potasio. La suspensin se sonic en hielo durante 10 minutos y luego se centrifug a 10.000 x g durante 10 minutos. Se retir el sobrenadante y se evalu el nivel de peroxidacin lipdica usando el ensayo de sustancias reactivas tiobarbitricas. Resultados Bacterial cells (10 6 or more) were collected and centrifuged, an isotonic saline wash step was performed before the pellet was resuspended in potassium chloride assay buffer. The suspension was sonicated on ice for 10 minutes and then centrifuged at 10,000 xg for 10 minutes. The supernatant was removed and the level of lipid peroxidation was assessed using the thiobarbiturate reactive substance assay. Results

Los resultados de los experimentos se muestran en la Figura 8. La Figura 8 muestra que MRx029 es capaz de inhibir la peroxidacin lipdica en aproximadamente un 20%, que es una capacidad antioxidante ms lata que el control positivo, hidroxitolueno butilado (1% p/v).The results of the experiments are shown in Figure 8. Figure 8 shows that MRx029 is able to inhibit lipid peroxidation by approximately 20%, which is a higher antioxidant capacity than the positive control, butylated hydroxytoluene (1% w/ v).

Ejemplo 6 - Eficacia de los inculos bacterianos sobre la actividad de histona desacetilasaExample 6 - Efficacy of bacterial inocula on histone deacetylase activity

ResumenSummary

Se investig la capacidad de las composiciones que comprenden cepas bacterianas de acuerdo con la invencin para alterar la actividad de la histona desacetilasa. La desregulacin de la histona desacetilasa se ha implicado en la patognesis asociada con enfermedades neurodegenerativas asociadas con la edad.The ability of compositions comprising bacterial strains according to the invention to alter histone deacetylase activity was investigated. Histone deacetylase dysregulation has been implicated in the pathogenesis associated with age-associated neurodegenerative diseases.

Material y mtodosMaterial and methods

Cepa bacterianabacterial strain

Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029 Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029

Lnea celularCellphone line

Se us la lnea celular HT-29 porque la histona desacetilasa est presente.The HT-29 cell line was used because histone deacetylase is present.

MtodoMethod

Se aislaron sobrenadantes libres de clulas de cultivos bacterianos en fase estacionaria por centrifugacin y filtracin en un filtro de 0,22 pM. Se usaron clulas HT-29 3 das despus de la confluencia y se redujeron escalonadamente en 1 ml de DTS 24 horas antes del comienzo del experimento. Las clulas HT-29 se desafiaron con un sobrenadante libre de clulas al 10% diluido en DTS y se dej incubar durante 48 horas. Luego se extrajeron las protenas de nucleasas usando el kit de extraccin de nucleasas de Sigma Aldrich y las muestras se congelaron al instante antes de la medicin de la actividad de HDAC. La actividad de HDAC se evalu fluoromtricamente usando el kit Sigma Aldrich (Reino Unido).Cell-free supernatants from bacterial cultures in stationary phase were isolated by centrifugation and filtration on a 0.22 pM filter. HT-29 cells were used 3 days after confluency and stepwise reduced in 1 ml DTS 24 hours before the start of the experiment. HT-29 cells were challenged with 10% cell-free supernatant diluted in DTS and allowed to incubate for 48 hours. Nuclease proteins were then extracted using the Sigma Aldrich Nuclease Extraction Kit and samples snap frozen prior to measurement of HDAC activity. HDAC activity was assessed fluorometrically using the Sigma Aldrich kit (UK).

ResultadosResults

Los resultados de los experimentos se muestran en la Figura 9. La Figura 9 muestra que MRx0029 puede reducir los niveles de la actividad de histona desacetilasa.The results of the experiments are shown in Figure 9. Figure 9 shows that MRx0029 can reduce the levels of histone deacetylase activity.

Ejemplo 7 - Nivel de produccin de indol en bacteriasExample 7 - Level of indole production in bacteria

ResumenSummary

Se investig la capacidad de las bacterias de la invencin para producir indol. El indol se ha implicado en la atenuacin de la inflamacin y el estrs oxidativo. The ability of the bacteria of the invention to produce indole was investigated. Indole has been implicated in the attenuation of inflammation and oxidative stress.

Material y mtodosMaterial and methods

Cepa bacterianabacterial strain

Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029 Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029

ATCC 11775 es una cepa de referencia bacteriana que se sabe que produce indol.ATCC 11775 is a bacterial reference strain known to produce indole.

MtodoMethod

Se incubaron clulas bacterianas intactas en fase estacionaria con triptfano 6 mM durante 48 horas. Las especies bacterianas que poseen la enzima triptofanasa utilizarn el triptfano como sustrato para producir indol. Despus del perodo de incubacin de 48 horas, se retir el sobrenadante y se aadi al reactivo de Kovac para cuantificar el indol. Se prepararon estndares, soluciones madre y reactivos usando mtodos estandarizados validados internamente.Intact bacterial cells in stationary phase were incubated with 6 mM tryptophan for 48 hours. Bacterial species that possess the enzyme tryptophanase will use tryptophan as a substrate to produce indole. After the 48 hour incubation period, the supernatant was removed and added to Kovac's reagent to quantify indole. Standards, stock solutions and reagents were prepared using internally validated standardized methods.

ResultadosResults

Los resultados de los experimentos se muestran en la Figura 10. La Figura 10 muestra que MRx0029 tiene la capacidad de producir indol a partir de triptfano, a concentraciones de aproximadamente 0,2 mM.The results of the experiments are shown in Figure 10. Figure 10 shows that MRx0029 has the ability to produce indole from tryptophan, at concentrations of approximately 0.2 mM.

Ejemplo 8 - Nivel de produccin de quinurenina en bacteriasExample 8 - Level of kynurenine production in bacteria

ResumenSummary

Se investig la capacidad de las bacterias de la invencin para producir quinurenina. La desregulacin de la ruta de la quinurenina puede llevar a la activacin del sistema inmune y la acumulacin de compuestos potencialmente neurotxicos. Las alteraciones en el metabolismo de la quinurenina pueden estar involucradas en el desarrollo de las enfermedades de Parkinson.The ability of the bacteria of the invention to produce kynurenine was investigated. Dysregulation of the kynurenine pathway can lead to activation of the immune system and accumulation of potentially neurotoxic compounds. Alterations in kynurenine metabolism may be involved in the development of Parkinson's diseases.

Cepa bacterianabacterial strain

Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029 Megasphaera massiliensis M Rx0029

DSM 17136 es una cepa de Bacteroides copricola que se sabe que produce quinurenina.DSM 17136 is a strain of Bacteroides copricola known to produce kynurenine.

MtodoMethod

Los sobrenadantes libres de clulas de cultivos bacterianos de fase estacionaria se aislaron por centrifugacin y filtracin en un filtro de 0,22 pM y se congelaron hasta su uso. Los estndares de quinurenina, soluciones madre y reactivos se prepararon usando mtodos estandarizados validados internamente. Las muestras se trataron con cido tricloroactico y se centrifugaron a 10.000xg durante 10 minutos a 4 C. El sobrenadante se recogi y se dispens en una placa de 96 pocillos. El reactivo de Ehrlich se us para la deteccin de quinurenina y se aadi en una proporcin de 1:1.Cell-free supernatants from stationary phase bacterial cultures were isolated by centrifugation and filtration on a 0.22 pM filter and frozen until use. Kynurenine standards, stock solutions and reagents were prepared using internally validated standardized methods. Samples were treated with trichloroacetic acid and centrifuged at 10,000xg for 10 minutes at 4C. The supernatant was collected and dispensed into a 96-well plate. Ehrlich's reagent was used for the detection of kynurenine and was added in a 1:1 ratio.

ResultadosResults

Los resultados de los experimentos se muestran en la Figura 11. La Figura 11 muestra que MRx0029 tiene la capacidad de producir quinurenina a una concentracin de aproximadamente 40 pM.The results of the experiments are shown in Figure 11. Figure 11 shows that MRx0029 has the ability to produce kynurenine at a concentration of approximately 40 pM.

Ejemplo 9 - Niveles de dopamina, DOPAC y HVA en el cuerpo estriado en ratones MPTP tratados con bacteriasExample 9 - Dopamine, DOPAC and HVA levels in the striatum in MPTP mice treated with bacteria

La enfermedad de Parkinson es un trastorno neurodegenerativo comn cuyas caractersticas clnicas cardinales incluyen temblor, lentitud de movimiento, rigidez e inestabilidad postural. Estos sntomas son principalmente atribuibles a la degeneracin de las neuronas dopaminrgicas en la sustancia negra pars compacta y la consiguiente prdida de sus fibras nerviosas proyectadas en el cuerpo estriado [60]. Los ratones tratados con MPTP (1 -metil-4-fenil-1,2,3,6-tetrahidropiridina) pierden selectivamente un nmero significativo de neuronas dopaminrgicas nigrostriatales [61]. La prdida inducida por MPTP de clulas dopaminrgicas en sustancia negra imita la condicin clnica de la enfermedad de Parkinson y es, por lo tanto, un modelo til para probar frmacos contra el Parkinson.Parkinson's disease is a common neurodegenerative disorder whose cardinal clinical features include tremor, slowness of movement, rigidity, and postural instability. These symptoms are mainly attributable to the degeneration of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra pars compacta and the consequent loss of their projecting nerve fibers in the striatum [60]. MPTP (1-methyl-4-phenyl-1,2,3,6-tetrahydropyridine)-treated mice selectively lose a significant number of nigrostriatal dopaminergic neurons [61]. MPTP-induced loss of dopaminergic cells in substantia nigra mimics the clinical condition of Parkinson's disease and is therefore a useful model for testing anti-Parkinsonian drugs.

El objetivo de este estudio fue evaluar los efectos de la bacteria anaerbica MRX0029 usando ratones lesionados con MPTP. The aim of this study was to evaluate the effects of the anaerobic bacterium MRX0029 using MPTP-injured mice.

Se asignaron 48 ratones macho a 4 grupos de tratamiento diferentes (grupos A, B, E e I, con n=12 animales en cada grupo). Los grupos de tratamiento se muestran en la Tabla 1 a continuacin y el curso del tiempo del proyecto se describe a continuacin. 48 male mice were assigned to 4 different treatment groups (Groups A, B, E and I, with n=12 animals in each group). The treatment groups are shown in Table 1 below and the time course of the project is described below.

Los grupos A, B, E e I fueron tratados diariamente durante 18 das mediante sonda oral con bacterias (MRx0029-grupo E) o vehculo (PBS). El tratamiento oral comenz 14 das antes de la lesin MPTP. Los animales del grupo I recibieron un tratamiento diario con vehculo (PBS) p.o. (por va oral) y se les inyect i.p. (intraperitoneal) con el frmaco de referencia 30 minutos antes y 90 minutos despus del primer MPTP en el da 0. El volumen de aplicacin para el tratamiento con vehculo y p.o. fue de 200 pl por ratn. La cepa de bacterias del grupo E era de reservas de glicerol (gly). Para el tratamiento oral, se almacenaron sondas de alimentacin para aplicaciones en un vial que contena etanol al 70% y se enjuagaron antes y despus de cada uso con agua destilada. Cada grupo de tratamiento tena su propio vial de sonda de alimentacin y etanol y vial de agua destilada. Los tubos y las sondas de alimentacin no se cambiaron entre los grupos. Directamente antes del tratamiento cada jeringuilla se enjuago con N2.Groups A, B, E and I were treated daily for 18 days by oral gavage with bacteria (MRx0029-group E) or vehicle (PBS). Oral treatment began 14 days before MPTP injury. Group I animals received daily vehicle treatment (PBS) p.o. (orally) and injected i.p. (intraperitoneal) with the reference drug 30 minutes before and 90 minutes after the first MPTP on day 0. The application volume for vehicle treatment and p.o. was 200 pl per mouse. The strain of bacteria from group E was of glycerol (gly) reserves. For oral treatment, feeding tubes for applications were stored in a vial containing 70% ethanol and rinsed before and after each use with distilled water. Each treatment group had its own vial of feeding tube and ethanol and vial of distilled water. Tubes and feeding tubes were not changed between groups. Directly before treatment each syringe was flushed with N2.

En el da 0 de MPTP (20 mg/kg de peso corporal (p.c.) se inyect i.p. 4 veces, intervalo de 2 h entre tratamientos) en animales de los grupos B, E e I. Un grupo de animales (A) se lesion simulando por administracin i.p. de vehculo MPTP (solucin salina al 0,9%). El volumen de aplicacin fue de 10 pl por g de peso corporal. El pesaje de los animales se realiz antes del tratamiento con MPTP para dosificar a los animales de acuerdo con su peso corporal real. Posteriormente los animales recibieron el tratamiento de p.o. diario.On day 0 MPTP (20 mg/kg body weight (b.w.) was injected i.p. 4 times, 2 h interval between treatments) in animals of groups B, E and I. One group of animals (A) was injured simulating by i.p. administration of MPTP vehicle (0.9% saline). The application volume was 10 pl per g of body weight. Weighing of the animals was performed prior to MPTP treatment to dose the animals according to their actual body weight. Subsequently, the animals received the treatment of p.o. daily.

Formulacin de preparaciones para dosificacin y preparacin de reservas de glicerol paraFormulation of preparations for dosage and preparation of glycerol reserves for

dosificacindosage

Para el grupo de tratamiento E (MRx0029) For treatment group E ( MRx0029)

1. ) Se tom 1 reserva de glicerol del congelador a -80 C y se coloc en condiciones anaerbicas (frasco anaerbico con bolsita) a 37 C para descongelar (esto llev 30-40 minutos).1.) 1 stock of glycerol was taken from the -80C freezer and placed under anaerobic conditions (anaerobic jar with sachet) at 37C to thaw (this took 30-40 minutes).

2. ) El stock de glicerol completamente descongelado se centrifug a 6000 x g durante 10 minutos a temperatura ambiente.2.) The fully thawed glycerol stock was centrifuged at 6000 x g for 10 min at room temperature.

3. ) El sobrenadante se desech sin alterar el sedimento (por ejemplo, usando una pipeta).3.) The supernatant was discarded without disturbing the pellet (eg, using a pipette).

4. ) Se aadieron 4,22 ml de 1 x PBS estril precalentada (37 C) y se mezcl suavemente usando una pipeta.4.) 4.22 mL of prewarmed (37C) sterile 1x PBS was added and mixed gently using a pipette.

5. ) A los ratones se les dosific con 200 l de la solucin bacteriana. A los animales se les dosific en el plazo de 15 minutos despus de la resuspensin del sedimento con PBS.5.) Mice were dosed with 200 l of the bacterial solution. Animals were dosed within 15 minutes after resuspension of the pellet with PBS.

Formulacin del grupo de frmacos de referenciaFormulation of the group of reference drugs

La cantidad apropiada de 7-nitroindazol se disolvi en aceite de cacahuete para alcanzar la concentracin final de 50 mg/kg.The appropriate amount of 7-nitroindazole was dissolved in peanut oil to reach the final concentration of 50 mg/kg.

Materiales y mtodosMaterials and methods

Animales Animals

Manejo especfico de animales y aleatorizacinSpecific animal management and randomization

Los guantes se cambiaron entre cada grupo de tratamiento y se rociaron con una solucin de etanol al 70% entre cada jaula del mismo grupo para minimizar el riesgo de contaminacin cada vez que se manipulaban animales (por ejemplo: tratamiento, pruebas de comportamiento, limpieza y muestreo de tejidos).Gloves were changed between each treatment group and sprayed with a 70% ethanol solution between each cage of the same group to minimize the risk of contamination each time animals were handled (for example: treatment, behavioral tests, cleaning and tissue sampling).

El tratamiento fue aleatorio y alternado diariamente para evitar que los mismos grupos se tratasen a la misma hora todos los das. Los animales fueron aleatorizados por jaula en el muestreo de tejido.Treatment was randomized and alternated daily to avoid the same groups being treated at the same time each day. Animals were randomized by cage in tissue sampling.

Muestreo y procesamiento de tejidos.Sampling and processing of tissues.

El da 4 se sacrificaron animales de todos los grupos y se recogieron los cerebros. Por lo tanto, los ratones se anestesiaron profundamente mediante inyeccin de pentobarbital (600 mg/kg).On day 4 animals from all groups were sacrificed and brains harvested. Therefore, the mice were deeply anesthetized by injection of pentobarbital (600 mg/kg).

Se recogi sangre (aproximadamente 500 gl) mediante puncin cardaca. Los ratones fueron luego perfundidos transcardiacamente con solucin salina al 0,9% y se retiraron los cerebros y se hemiseccionaron. El hemisferio izquierdo se subdividi en tejido estriatal (para HPLC), el tejido de sustancia negra y el cerebro residual, se pesaron e inmediatamente se congelaron y almacenaron a -80 C. Los instrumentos y las superficies que estaban en contacto con los animales tuvieron que limpiarse con etanol al 70% antes de diseccionar el siguiente animal. Anlisis bioqumico de los niveles de dopamina, DOPAC y HVA con HPLC en el cuerpo estriado Blood (approximately 500 gl) was collected by cardiac puncture. Mice were then transcardially perfused with 0.9% saline and brains removed and hemisected. The left hemisphere was subdivided into striatal tissue (for HPLC), substantia nigra tissue, and residual brain, weighed, and immediately frozen and stored at -80C. Instruments and surfaces that were in contact with the animals had to be cleaned with 70% ethanol before dissecting the next animal. Biochemical analysis of dopamine, DOPAC and HVA levels with HPLC in the striatum

Las muestras estriatales (n=6 de cada grupo de tratamiento; un total de 24 muestras) se mezclaron a una proporcin de 1:10 (p/v) con cido perclrico 0,2M incluyendo 100 gM de EDTA-2Na y se homogeneizaron a 0 C en un homogeneizador Pestlemicro de vidrio. Despus de reposar durante 30 minutos en hielo, los homogeneizados se centrifugaron a 10.000 RPM durante 10 minutos en una centrfuga refrigerada Biofuge Fresco (Heraeus Instruments, Alemania). Los sobrenadantes se aspiraron cuidadosamente y se mezclaron con tampn de acetato de sodio 0,4 M, pH 3 a una proporcin 1:2 (v/v) y se filtraron a travs de un filtro centrfugo de 0,22 gm (Merck Millipore, Alemania) durante 4 minutos a 14000 g a 4 C. Los filtrados se almacenaron a -80 C antes del anlisis por HPLC.Striatal samples (n=6 from each treatment group; a total of 24 samples) were mixed at a ratio of 1:10 (w/v) with 0.2M perchloric acid including 100 gM 2Na-EDTA and homogenized at 0C in a glass Pestlemicro homogenizer. After standing for 30 minutes on ice, the homogenates were centrifuged at 10,000 RPM for 10 minutes in a Biofuge Fresco refrigerated centrifuge (Heraeus Instruments, Germany). Supernatants were carefully aspirated and mixed with 0.4 M sodium acetate buffer, pH 3 at a 1:2 (v/v) ratio and filtered through a 0.22 gm centrifugal filter (Merck Millipore, Germany) for 4 min at 14000 g at 4C. The filtrates were stored at -80C before HPLC analysis.

Anlisis por HPLCHPLC analysis

Las concentraciones de DA, DOPAC y HVA en las muestras estriatales se determinaron por cromatografa lquida en columna con deteccin electroqumica [62; 63]. Se us el sistema HPLC (HTEC-500, Eicom Corp., Kyoto, Japn) que incluye una bomba de microflujo de pulso libre, un desgasificador y un detector amperomtrico equipado con un electrodo de carbono vidrioso que funciona a 0,45 V frente a un electrodo de referencia de Ag/AgCl. Las muestras se inyectaron mediante el uso de un micromuestreador refrigerado CMA/200 (CMA/Microdialisys, Estocolmo, Suecia). Los cromatogramas se registraron e integraron mediante el uso de un sistema de adquisicin de datos computarizado (DataApex, Praga, Repblica Checa). DA, DOPAC y HVA se separaron en una columna de 150 x 2,1 mm de dimetro (CA5-ODS, Eicom Corp., Kyoto, Japn). La fase mvil consisti en tampn fosfato 0,1 M a pH 6,0, EDTA 0,13 mM, 1-octanosulfonato de sodio 2,3 mM y metanol al 20% (v/v). El lmite de deteccin (proporcin de seal a ruido = 3) para DA se estim en 0,5 fmol en 15 gl (0,03 nM) inyectado en la columna.DA, DOPAC, and HVA concentrations in striatal samples were determined by liquid column chromatography with electrochemical detection [62; 63]. The HPLC system (HTEC-500, Eicom Corp., Kyoto, Japan) was used, which includes a pulse-free microflow pump, a degasser, and an amperometric detector equipped with a glassy carbon electrode operating at 0.45 V vs. an Ag/AgCl reference electrode. Samples were injected using a CMA/200 refrigerated microsampler (CMA/Microdialisys, Stockholm, Sweden). Chromatograms were recorded and integrated using a computerized data acquisition system (DataApex, Prague, Czech Republic). DA, DOPAC and HVA were separated on a 150 x 2.1 mm diameter column (CA5-ODS, Eicom Corp., Kyoto, Japan). The mobile phase consisted of 0.1 M phosphate buffer at pH 6.0, 0.13 mM EDTA, 2.3 mM sodium 1-octanesulfonate, and 20% (v/v) methanol. The detection limit (signal to noise ratio = 3) for DA was estimated to be 0.5 fmol in 15 gL (0.03 nM) injected onto the column.

ResultadosResults

La administracin de cepas de bacterias fue bien tolerada por los animales. El da de la lesin MPTP y, si es necesario, el da posterior, se us una luz roja para calentar a los animales. Si los animales estaban en malas condiciones (se sentan fros, deshidratados, comportamiento anormal), se les suministr comida hmeda y tratamiento salino subcutneo si fue necesario.The administration of bacterial strains was well tolerated by the animals. On the day of MPTP injury and, if necessary, the day after, a red light was used to warm the animals. If the animals were in poor condition (feeling cold, dehydrated, abnormal behavior), they were given wet food and subcutaneous saline treatment if necessary.

Para el anlisis de los niveles de dopamina, DOPAC y HVA, se us tejido estriado de 6 animales por grupo de tratamiento. Los datos se analizaron mediante la prueba de Kruskal-Wallis seguida de la prueba post hoc de comparacin mltiple de Dunn o el anlisis de varianza unidireccional seguido de la prueba post hoc de Bonferroni (A frente a todos (*), B frente a todos, I frente a todos (#)). */# = p <0,05; ** = p <0,01; *** = p0,001.For the analysis of dopamine, DOPAC and HVA levels, striatal tissue from 6 animals per treatment group was used. Data were analyzed using the Kruskal-Wallis test followed by Dunn's multiple comparison post hoc test or one-way analysis of variance followed by the Bonferroni post hoc test. (A in front of all (*), B in front of all, I in front of all (#)). */# = p<0.05; ** = p <0.01; *** = p0.001.

Los animales sanos en el grupo A tenan altos niveles de dopamina, DOPAC y HVA, mientras que el tratamiento con MPTP en el grupo B redujo esto y el control positivo (grupo I) recuper la produccin en algn grado (Figura 12). Los animales del grupo I tendieron a tener niveles de dopamina ms altos que el grupo tratado con bacterias y el grupo B. Los niveles de DOPAC (un metabolito de dopamina) en general fueron significativamente ms bajos en animales del grupo B en comparacin con los niveles de DOPAC de animales no lesionados del grupo A (Figura 12B).Healthy animals in group A had high levels of dopamine, DOPAC and HVA, while MPTP treatment in group B reduced this and the positive control (group I) recovered production to some degree (Figure 12). Group I animals tended to have higher dopamine levels than the bacteria-treated group and group B. Levels of DOPAC (a dopamine metabolite) were generally significantly lower in group B animals compared to levels of DOPAC from uninjured animals of group A (FIG. 12B).

Significativamente, se descubri que el tratamiento con MRx0029 (grupo E) recuperaba la produccin de dopamina y DOPAC (Figuras 12A y 12B, respectivamente). Por lo tanto, el tratamiento con MRx0029 puede ser til para tratar o prevenir trastornos neurodegenerativos.Significantly, treatment with MRx0029 (group E) was found to restore dopamine and DOPAC production (Figures 12A and 12B, respectively). Therefore, MRx0029 treatment may be useful in treating or preventing neurodegenerative disorders.

Ejemplo 10 - Eficacia de las bacterias para alterar el crecimiento de neuritasExample 10 - Efficacy of Bacteria to Impair Neurite Growth

ResumenSummary

El crecimiento de neuritas es un proceso importante para el desarrollo de conexiones entre neuronas. Por lo tanto, la capacidad de las cepas bacterianas y los cidos orgnicos para inducir el crecimiento de neuritas se prob midiendo los niveles transcripcionales de la protena asociada a microtbulos MAP2, un marcador de diferenciacin neuronal especfico.Neurite outgrowth is an important process for the development of connections between neurons. Therefore, the ability of bacterial strains and organic acids to induce neurite outgrowth was tested by measuring transcriptional levels of the microtubule-associated protein MAP2, a neuron-specific marker of differentiation.

Cepa bacterianabacterial strain

Megasphaera massiliensis MRX0029. Megasphaera massiliensis MRX0029.

MtodoMethod

SHSY5Y se sembraron en placas de Petri de 10 cm a una densidad de 2 x 106 clulas. Despus de 24 h, las clulas se trataron en medio de diferenciacin (medio de crecimiento que contena FBS al 1% sin RA) con sobrenadantes de bacterias al 10% o YCFA+, RA 10uM, cido hexanoico 200 uM o cido valproico 200 uM, durante 17 h. Posteriormente se tomaron imgenes representativas usando un microscopio de ncleo EVOS XL de contraste de fase con un aumento de 40X/0,65. Se recogieron las clulas y se aisl el ARN total de acuerdo con el protocolo del RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen). Los ADNc se elaboraron usando el kit de transcripcin inversa de ADNc de alta capacidad (Applied Biosystems). La expresin gnica se midi usando qPCR. Se us GAPDH como control interno. Las veces cambio se calcularon de acuerdo con el mtodo 2(-ct).SHSY5Y were seeded in 10 cm Petri dishes at a density of 2 x 10 6 cells. After 24 h, cells were treated in differentiation medium (growth medium containing 1% FBS without RA) with 10% bacteria supernatants or YCFA+, 10 uM RA, 200 uM hexanoic acid or 200 uM valproic acid, for 5 p.m. Representative images were then taken using an EVOS XL phase contrast core microscope at 40X/0.65 magnification. Cells were harvested and total RNA isolated according to the RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen) protocol. cDNAs were made using the High Throughput cDNA Reverse Transcription Kit (Applied Biosystems). Gene expression was measured using qPCR. GAPDH was used as an internal control. The fold change was calculated according to the 2(-ct) method.

Inmunofluorescencia y microscopa confocalImmunofluorescence and confocal microscopy

Las clulas se sembraron en portaobjetos de cmara de 8 pocillos (Marienfeld Laboratory Glassware) a 5x104 clulas/pocillo durante la noche y se trataron con sobrenadante bacteriano al 10% durante 24 h. Para la diferenciacin, las clulas se trataron con cido retinoico 10nM durante 5 das antes de tratarlas con sobrenadante bacteriano. Luego se fijaron las clulas con paraformaldehdo al 4% en PBS durante 20 minutos a temperatura ambiente (RT). Las clulas fijadas se lavaron con PBS y se permeabilizaron con Triton X-100 al 1% en PBS durante 10 minutos. Despus de lavar con PBS, los portaobjetos se incubaron con tampn de bloqueo (BSA/PBS al 4%) durante 1 hora a temperatura ambiente antes de aadir el anticuerpo anti-MAP2 (sc-74421, Santa Cruz Biotechnology Inc) diluido en BSA/PBS al 1% durante 12 horas a 4 C. Luego se lavaron dos veces con PBS, seguido de incubacin con el anti-ratn conjugado Alexa Flour 488 (Molecular Probes Inc) y faloidina conjugada con Alexa Flour 594 (ab176757, Abeam) durante 1 hora a RT. Despus de lavar 3 veces con PBS, los portaobjetos se montaron con VectorshieldD que contiene DAPI (Sigma, Aldrich). Los portaobjetos se vieron usando un microscopio Zeiss Axioscope equipado con un objetivo Korr de 63x/1.2 W y conjuntos de filtros adecuados para la deteccin de los fluorocromos usados. Los tiempos de exposicin manual para la adquisicin digital de imgenes inmunomarcadas con MAP-2 se mantuvieron constantes permitiendo la comparacin entre diferentes pocillos y tratamientos. Los tiempos de exposicin a faloidina (F-actina) y DAPI variaron para adaptarse al campo de visin. Los campos de visin aleatorizados se adquirieron usando una cmara Qlmaging controlada por el software Image Pro Plus. Las imgenes se guardaron como TIF y se abrieron en Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.1.2 y las superposiciones de las imgenes MAP-2, DAPI y Phalloidion se superpusieron y fusionaron. Se seleccionaron imgenes representativas para ilustrar las diferencias en abundancia y localizacin de las protenas examinadas. Resultados Cells were seeded on 8-well chamber slides (Marienfeld Laboratory Glassware) at 5x10 4 cells/well overnight and treated with 10% bacterial supernatant for 24 h. For differentiation, cells were treated with 10nM retinoic acid for 5 days before being treated with bacterial supernatant. Cells were then fixed with 4% paraformaldehyde in PBS for 20 min at room temperature (RT). Fixed cells were washed with PBS and permeabilized with 1% Triton X-100 in PBS for 10 minutes. After washing with PBS, slides were incubated with blocking buffer (4% BSA/PBS) for 1 hour at room temperature before adding anti-MAP2 antibody (sc-74421, Santa Cruz Biotechnology Inc) diluted in BSA/ 1% PBS for 12 hours at 4C. They were then washed twice with PBS, followed by incubation with Alexa Flour 488 conjugated anti-mouse (Molecular Probes Inc) and Alexa Flour 594 conjugated phalloidin (ab176757, Abeam) for 1 hour at RT. After washing 3 times with PBS, slides were mounted with VectorshieldD containing DAPI (Sigma, Aldrich). Slides were viewed using a Zeiss Axioscope microscope equipped with a 63x/1.2 W Korr objective and appropriate filter sets for detection of the fluorochromes used. Manual exposure times for digital acquisition of MAP-2 immunolabeled images were kept constant allowing comparison between different wells and treatments. Phalloidin (F-actin) and DAPI exposure times varied to suit the field of view. Randomized fields of view were acquired using a Qlmaging camera controlled by Image Pro Plus software. Images were saved as TIFs and opened in Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.1.2 and overlays of MAP-2, DAPI and Phalloidion images were overlaid and merged. Representative images were selected to illustrate the differences in abundance and localization of the proteins examined. Results

Los resultados se muestran en la Figura 13. La Figura 13A muestra imgenes de microscopa representativas de clulas SHSY-5Y no diferenciadas incubadas con cada uno de los sobrenadantes de cidos y bacterias. El tratamiento de las clulas con MRX0029 indujo un fenotipo similar a una neurona, mostrando caractersticas similares a las clulas tratadas con cido retinoico (que se usa para la diferenciacin terminal de las clulas de neuroblastoma), donde los cuerpos celulares son ms grandes y de forma piramidal, con neuritas y ramificaciones procesadas fuera de la red con celdas colindantes. La Figura 13B muestra que MRx0029 regula por incremento significativamente MAP2 en clulas de neuroblastoma no diferenciadas. La tincin con faloidina (un agente de unin al citoesqueleto de actina) demostr adems una disposicin diferente de la estructura citoesqueltica en las clulas tratadas con MRx0029, lo que respalda an ms la hiptesis de diferenciacin neuronal para MRx0029 (Fig. 13B).The results are shown in Figure 13. Figure 13A shows representative microscopy images of undifferentiated SHSY-5Y cells incubated with each of the acid and bacterial supernatants. Treatment of cells with MRX0029 induced a neuron-like phenotype, showing features similar to cells treated with retinoic acid (which is used for terminal differentiation of cells). neuroblastoma cells), where the cell bodies are larger and pyramidal in shape, with neurites and ramifications processed out of the network with adjoining cells. Figure 13B shows that MRx0029 significantly upregulates MAP2 in undifferentiated neuroblastoma cells. Staining with phalloidin (an actin cytoskeleton-binding agent) further demonstrated a different arrangement of cytoskeletal structure in MRx0029-treated cells, further supporting the neuronal differentiation hypothesis for MRx0029 (Fig. 13B).

Ejemplo 11 - Eficacia de los inculos bacterianos para reducir los niveles oxidativos en las clulas.Example 11 - Efficacy of bacterial inocula to reduce oxidative levels in cells.

AntecedentesBackground

La generacin de especies reactivas de oxgeno contribuye a la patologa de las enfermedades neurodegenerativas. Se investig la capacidad de las cepas bacterianas para proteger las clulas SHSY-5Y y U373 diferenciadas de las especies reactivas de oxgeno (ROS) generadas por el tratamiento con perxido de hidrgeno de terc-butilo (TBHP).The generation of reactive oxygen species contributes to the pathology of neurodegenerative diseases. The ability of bacterial strains to protect differentiated SHSY-5Y and U373 cells from reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated by tert-butyl hydrogen peroxide (TBHP) treatment was investigated.

Material y mtodosMaterial and methods

Cepa bacterianabacterial strain

Megasphaera massiliensis M RX0029 Megasphaera massiliensis M RX0029

MtodoMethod

Se colocaron en placas clulas SHSY-5Y en placas de 96 pocillos de fondo plano negro a una densidad de 5000 clulas/pocillo y se colocaron en la incubadora de CO2. Despus de 24 h, los medios se reemplazaron por medio de diferenciacin (medio de crecimiento que contena FBS al 1%) y 10 pM de cido retinoico. El medio de diferenciacin se reemplaz cada dos das. El da 10 se retir el medio de diferenciacin y las clulas se lavaron con PBS precalentado y se tieron con sonda molecular DCFDA 10 mM durante 20 minutos en medio de crecimiento que contena FBS al 1%. Luego, las clulas se lavaron con PBS precalentado de nuevo y se trataron con TBHP 100uM en presencia o ausencia de sobrenadante de bacterias al 10% durante 2 h. La intensidad de fluorescencia se midi usando el lector de placas TECAN a Ex/Em 485/530 nm.SHSY-5Y cells were plated in black flat bottom 96-well plates at a density of 5000 cells/well and placed in the CO2 incubator. After 24 h, the media were replaced with differentiation medium (growth medium containing 1% FBS) and 10 pM retinoic acid. The differentiation medium was replaced every two days. On day 10, differentiation medium was removed and cells were washed with prewarmed PBS and stained with 10 mM DCFDA molecular probe for 20 minutes in growth medium containing 1% FBS. Cells were then washed with prewarmed PBS again and treated with 100uM TBHP in the presence or absence of 10% bacteria supernatant for 2 h. Fluorescence intensity was measured using the TECAN plate reader at Ex/Em 485/530 nm.

ResultadosResults

Los resultados de los experimentos se muestran en la Figura 14. La Figura 14b muestra que MRX0029 puede inhibir la produccin de ROS en clulas de neuroblastoma SHSY-5Y diferenciadas. MRX0029 no tuvo un efecto sobre la generacin de ROS en clulas de astroglioblastoma U373 (Figura 14a). Esto muestra que este aspecto del efecto antioxidante es especfico de neuronas.The results of the experiments are shown in Figure 14. Figure 14b shows that MRX0029 can inhibit ROS production in differentiated SHSY-5Y neuroblastoma cells. MRX0029 did not have an effect on ROS generation in U373 astroglioblastoma cells (FIG. 14a). This shows that this aspect of the antioxidant effect is specific to neurons.

Ejemplo 12 - neuroproteccinExample 12 - neuroprotection

Las clulas SHSY-5Y diferenciadas con RA se trataron con MPP+, el metabolito activo de MPTP, un producto qumico ampliamente usado para imitar in vitro e in vivo algunas de las caractersticas de la patologa de la EP. La viabilidad celular se midi como la tasa de respiracin de las mitocondrias (Figura 15). Tanto MRx0005 como MRx0029 mostraron efectos significativos y promueven per se un aumento de la actividad metablica de las mitocondrias en las clulas SHSY-5Y. MRX0029 mostr una proteccin completa contra MPP+, restaurando la viabilidad celular casi al mismo nivel de clulas no tratadas y ms alto que el control positivo de quercetina. La proteccin de MRx0005 fue de aproximadamente el 20% en comparacin con la muestra tratada con YCFA-MPP+, aproximadamente la misma observada para el control positivo de quercetina (Fig. 15).RA-differentiated SHSY-5Y cells were treated with MPP+, the active metabolite of MPTP, a chemical widely used to mimic in vitro and in vivo some of the features of PD pathology. Cell viability was measured as the respiration rate of the mitochondria (FIG. 15). Both MRx0005 and MRx0029 showed significant effects and promote per se an increase in the metabolic activity of mitochondria in SHSY-5Y cells. MRX0029 showed complete protection against MPP+, restoring cell viability to nearly the same level as untreated cells and higher than the quercetin positive control. Protection of MRx0005 was approximately 20% compared to the YCFA-MPP+ treated sample, approximately the same observed for the quercetin positive control (FIG. 15).

Ejemplo 13 - Anlisis adicional del mecanismo de inhibicin de la desacetilacin de histonas Example 13 - Further analysis of the mechanism of inhibition of histone deacetylation IntroduccinIntroduction

La microbiota intestinal, con su inmensa diversidad y capacidad metablica, representa un enorme depsito metablico para la produccin de una amplia variedad de molculas con potencial para influir en la actividad de HDAC. Pocos estudios han evaluado la actividad inhibidora de HDAC de metabolitos derivados de microbios distintos del butirato, que se ha demostrado que inhibe HDAC y se asocia con una mejora de la funcin motora en la enfermedad de Huntington [64]. Por lo tanto, los inventores buscaron determinar qu metabolitos son responsables de la inhibicin de HDAC y dilucidar an ms los mecanismos por los cuales se logra la inhibicin.The gut microbiota, with its immense diversity and metabolic capacity, represents an enormous metabolic reservoir for the production of a wide variety of molecules with the potential to influence HDAC activity. Few studies have evaluated the HDAC inhibitory activity of microbially derived metabolites other than butyrate, which has been shown to inhibit HDAC and is associated with improved motor function in Huntington's disease [64]. Therefore, the inventors sought to determine which metabolites are responsible for HDAC inhibition and to further elucidate the mechanisms by which inhibition is achieved.

Material y mtodosMaterial and methods

Cultivo bacteriano y recogida de sobrenadante libre de clulas Bacterial culture and collection of cell-free supernatant

Se cultivaron anaerbicamente cultivos puros de bacterias en caldo YCFA hasta que alcanzaron su fase de crecimiento estacionaria. Los cultivos se centrifugaron a 5.000 x g durante 5 minutos y el sobrenadante libre de clulas (CFS) se filtr usando un filtro de 0,2 pM (Millipore, Reino Unido). Se almacenaron alcuotas de 1 ml de CFS a -80 C hasta su uso. Se obtuvieron butirato de sodio, cido hexanoico y valrico de Sigma Aldrich (Reino Unido) y se prepararon suspensiones en caldo YCFA.Pure cultures of bacteria were grown anaerobically in YCFA broth until they reached their stationary growth phase. Cultures were centrifuged at 5,000 x g for 5 minutes and cell free supernatant (CFS) was filtered using a 0.2 pM filter (Millipore, UK). Aliquots of 1 ml of CFS were stored at -80C until use. Sodium butyrate, hexanoic and valeric acid were obtained from Sigma Aldrich (UK) and suspensions were prepared in YCFA broth.

Cuantificacin de SCFA y MCFA de sobrenadantes bacterianosSCFA and MCFA quantification of bacterial supernatants

Se analizaron y cuantificaron los cidos grasos de cadena corta (SCFA) y los cidos grasos de cadena media (MCFA) de los sobrenadantes bacterianos por MS Omics APS de la siguiente manera. Las muestras se acidificaron usando cido clorhdrico y se aadieron patrones internos marcados con deuterio. Todas las muestras fueron analizadas en un orden aleatorio. El anlisis se realiz utilizando una columna de alta polaridad (Columna Zebron ZB-FFAP, GC Cap. 30 m x 0,25 mm x 0,25 pm) instalada en un GC (7890B, Agilent) acoplada con un detector de cuadropolos (59977B, Agilent). El sistema fue controlado por ChemStation (Agilent). Los datos brutos se convirtieron al formato netCDF usando Chemstation (Agilent), antes de que los datos se importaran y procesaran en Matlab R2014b (Mathworks, Inc.) usando el software PARADISe descrito en [65].Short chain fatty acids (SCFA) and medium chain fatty acids (MCFA) of bacterial supernatants were analyzed and quantified by MS Omics APS as follows. Samples were acidified using hydrochloric acid and deuterium-labeled internal standards were added. All samples were analyzed in a random order. Analysis was performed using a high polarity column (Zebron ZB-FFAP Column, GC Cap. 30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 pm) installed on a GC (7890B, Agilent) coupled with a quadrupole detector (59977B , Agilent). The system was controlled by ChemStation (Agilent). Raw data was converted to netCDF format using Chemstation (Agilent), before data was imported and processed in Matlab R2014b (Mathworks, Inc.) using PARADISe software described in [65].

Anlisis de actividad de HDAC especficoSpecific HDAC activity analysis

La actividad de inhibicin especfica de HDAC se analiz para HDAC1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9 usando kits de ensayo fluorognico para cada tipo de HDAC (BPS Bioscience, CA). Los ensayos se realizaron de acuerdo con las instrucciones del fabricante y cada muestra se realiz en rplicas. Los sobrenadantes libres de clulas se diluyeron 1 en 10 y se expusieron a protenas HDAC especficas proporcionadas en el kit para mantener la consistencia entre los mtodos.Specific HDAC inhibition activity was assayed for HDAC1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9 using fluorogenic assay kits for each type of HDAC (BPS Bioscience, CA). Assays were performed according to the manufacturer's instructions and each sample was performed in replicates. Cell-free supernatants were diluted 1 in 10 and challenged with specific HDAC proteins provided in the kit to maintain consistency between methods.

ResultadosResults

Los metabolitos microbianos comensales del intestino inhibidores de la histona desacetilasa son butirato y cido valricoThe histone deacetylase inhibitory commensal gut microbial metabolites are butyrate and valeric acid.

MRx0029, cuyo sobrenadante mostr una fuerte inhibicin de HDAC tanto en clulas completas HT29 como en lisados celulares de HT29, produjeron cido valrico y cido hexanoico a concentraciones medias de 5,08 mM y 1,60 mM, respectivamente (Figura 16a y C).MRx0029, whose supernatant showed strong HDAC inhibition in both whole HT29 cells and HT29 cell lysates, produced valeric acid and hexanoic acid at mean concentrations of 5.08 mM and 1.60 mM, respectively (Figure 16a and C).

Para investigar qu metabolitos fueron responsables de la inhibicin de HDAC inducida por la cepa, se midieron diferentes concentraciones de cido hexanoico, cido valrico y butirato de sodio para determinar su inhibicin de HDAC en clulas HT-29 completas y en lisado de clulas HT-29. Los resultados en la Fig. 16B muestran una inhibicin significativa (P<0,05) de la actividad HDAC por el butirato de sodio en clulas completas as como en el lisado celular, mientras que el cido hexanoico no mostr actividad inhibidora significativa. El cido valrico inhibi la actividad total de HDAC (* (p<0,05), ** (p<0,005), *** (P<0,001), **** (p<0,0001)).To investigate which metabolites were responsible for strain-induced HDAC inhibition, different concentrations of hexanoic acid, valeric acid, and sodium butyrate were measured for their HDAC inhibition in whole HT-29 cells and in HT-29 cell lysate. . The results in Fig. 16B show significant (P<0.05) inhibition of HDAC activity by sodium butyrate in whole cells as well as in cell lysate, while hexanoic acid showed no significant inhibitory activity. Valeric acid inhibited total HDAC activity (* (p<0.05), ** (p<0.005), *** (P<0.001), **** (p<0.0001)).

HDAC de clase I objetivo investigadas como inhibidores de HDAC totales potentes.Target class I HDACs investigated as potent total HDAC inhibitors.

Se investig el perfil de inhibicin especfico de HDAC de la cepa de bacterias de prueba. Se llevaron a cabo ensayos especficos de inhibicin de HDAC (BPS Bioscience, CA) para HDAC de Clase I y Clase II. La capacidad de la cepa bacteriana para inhibir las enzimas de HDAC se compar con el butirato, el cido hexanoico y el cido valrico. Nuestros resultados demuestran que MRX0029 es un inhibidor muy potente de las enzimas HDAC de Clase 1 (HDAC1,2 y 3). La inhibicin de los HDAC de clase II no fue tan significativa (datos no mostrados). PThe HDAC-specific inhibition profile of the test bacteria strain was investigated. Specific HDAC inhibition assays (BPS Bioscience, CA) were performed for Class I and Class II HDACs. The ability of the bacterial strain to inhibit HDAC enzymes was compared with butyrate, hexanoic acid, and valeric acid. Our results demonstrate that MRX0029 is a very potent inhibitor of HDAC Class 1 enzymes (HDAC1,2 and 3). Inhibition of class II HDACs was not as significant (data not shown). P

AnlisisAnalysis

La cepa con actividad inhibidora de HDAC produjo cantidades significativas de cido valrico y cido hexanoico, as como cantidades significativas de butirato de sodio (Figura 16C). Cuando se prob como sustancias puras, el cido valrico y el butirato de sodio produjeron una inhibicin significativa de HDAC (p<0,0001).The strain with HDAC inhibitory activity produced significant amounts of valeric acid and hexanoic acid, as well as significant amounts of sodium butyrate (FIG. 16C). When tested as pure substances, valeric acid and sodium butyrate produced significant HDAC inhibition (p<0.0001).

Curiosamente, los resultados de la actividad especfica de HDAC muestran que la cepa probada es un potente inhibidor de h Da C de Clase I, y particularmente HDAC2 (Figura 17 y 18). Los HDAC de clase I (HDAC 1, 2, 3 y 8) residen en el ncleo y se expresan de manera ubicua en varios tipos de clulas humanas. Las HDAC 1-3 comparten ms del 50% de homologa, pero tienen distintas estructuras y funciones celulares [66]. Estn implicadas principalmente en la supervivencia, la proliferacin y la diferenciacin celular, y por lo tanto su inhibicin puede ser til en una amplia gama de enfermedades [67]; [68]; [69]; [70] [71]Interestingly, the HDAC specific activity results show that the tested strain is a potent inhibitor of Class I hDaC, and particularly HDAC2 (Figure 17 and 18). Class I HDACs (HDACs 1, 2, 3, and 8) reside in the nucleus and are ubiquitously expressed in various human cell types. HDACs 1-3 share more than 50% homology, but have different cellular structures and functions [66]. They are mainly involved in cell survival, proliferation and differentiation, and therefore their inhibition may be useful in a wide range of diseases [67]; [68]; [69]; [70] [71]

Ejemplo 14 - Nivel de secrecin de BDNF en clulas SHSY-5Y Example 14 - Level of BDNF secretion in SHSY-5Y cells

AntecedentesBackground

El factor neurotrfico derivado del cerebro (BDNF) es una molcula ubicua en el cerebro asociada con el desarrollo neural, la neuroproteccin y la neuroregeneracin. BDNF no solo protege contra la neurodegeneracin sino tambin contra trastornos mentales como la depresin y la ansiedad, que son bastante comunes entre los pacientes diagnosticados con EP o EA.Brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) is a ubiquitous molecule in the brain associated with neural development, neuroprotection, and neuroregeneration. BDNF not only protects against neurodegeneration but also against mental disorders such as depression and anxiety, which are quite common among patients diagnosed with PD or AD.

MtodosMethods

Se colocaron en placas SH-SY5-SY en placas de 24 pocillos a una densidad de 60.000 clulas/pocillo y se colocaron en la incubadora. Despus de 24 h, los medios se reemplazaron por medio de diferenciacin (medio de crecimiento que contena FBS al 1%) y 10 |jM de cido retinoico. El medio de diferenciacin se reemplaz cada dos das y las clulas se usaron el da 10 de diferenciacin. Para el tratamiento, se elimin el medio de diferenciacin y se reemplaz con 450 ul de medio de crecimiento completo y se aadieron 50 j l de bacteria SN a los pocillos tratados o se aadi YCFA+ como control negativo.SH-SY5-SY were plated in 24-well plates at a density of 60,000 cells/well and placed in the incubator. After 24 h, the media were replaced with differentiation medium (growth medium containing 1% FBS) and 10 M retinoic acid. Differentiation medium was replaced every other day and cells were used on day 10 of differentiation. For treatment, differentiation medium was removed and replaced with 450 ul of complete growth medium and 50 ul of SN bacteria were added to treated wells or YCFA+ was added as a negative control.

ResultadosResults

Los resultados se muestran en la Figura 19, que muestra que la administracin de MRX0029 en combinacin con cido retinoico aumenta la secrecin de BDNF de las clulas de neuroblasoma diferenciadas. Por lo tanto, las composiciones que comprenden bacterias comensales y cidos orgnicos pueden ser tiles en terapia.The results are shown in Figure 19, which shows that administration of MRX0029 in combination with retinoic acid increases BDNF secretion from differentiated neuroblasome cells. Therefore, compositions comprising commensal bacteria and organic acids may be useful in therapy.

Ejemplo 15 - Produccin de metabolitos - metabolitos en el cerebroExample 15 - Production of metabolites - metabolites in the brain

AntecedentesBackground

Los metabolitos presentes en los sobrenadantes de bacterias pueden influir directamente en la respuesta del husped al estrs oxidativo, la comunicacin de clula a clula y la neuroproteccin. Los metabolitos que desempean un papel clave en los procesos neurolgicos se midieron durante el examen ex vivo en el tejido cerebral de ratones alimentados con MRx0005 y MRx0029.Metabolites present in bacterial supernatants can directly influence the host response to oxidative stress, cell-to-cell communication, and neuroprotection. Metabolites that play a key role in neurological processes were measured during ex vivo examination in brain tissue of mice fed MRx0005 and MRx0029.

MtodosMethods

AnimalesAnimals

Se alojaron en grupo ratones macho adultos BALBc (Envigo, Reino Unido) bajo un ciclo de luz-oscuridad de 12 h; comida para roedores estndar y agua estaban disponibles ad libitum. Todos los experimentos se realizaron de acuerdo con las directrices europeas tras la aprobacin del University College Cork Animal Ethics Experimentation Committee. Los animales tenan 8 semanas de edad al comienzo del experimento.Adult male BALBc mice (Envigo, UK) were group-housed under a 12-h light-dark cycle; Standard rodent chow and water were available ad libitum. All experiments were performed in accordance with European guidelines after approval by the University College Cork Animal Ethics Experimentation Committee. The animals were 8 weeks old at the beginning of the experiment.

Diseo del estudioStudy design

Se permiti a los animales habituarse a su sala de espera durante una semana despus de llegar a la unidad animal. Reciben alimentacin por sonda oral (dosis de 200 jl) de bioteraputicos vivos a una dosis de 1 X 109 UFC durante 6 das consecutivos entre las 15:00 y las 17:00. El da 7, los animales se decapitan y los tejidos se recogen para experimentacin.The animals were allowed to habituate to their waiting room for one week after arrival at the animal unit. They receive oral tube feeding (dose of 200 jl) of live biotherapeutics at a dose of 1 X 109 CFU for 6 consecutive days between 15:00 and 17:00. On day 7, the animals are decapitated and the tissues are harvested for experimentation.

Recogida de tejidostissue collection

Los animales se sacrificaron de manera aleatoria con respecto al tratamiento y la condicin de prueba; el muestreo se realiz entre las 9.00 a.m. y la 1 p.m. Se recogi sangre troncal en tubos de EDTA (cido etilendiaminotetraactico) de potasio y se centrifug durante 15 minutos a 4000 g. El plasma se aisl y se almacen a -80 C para su posterior anlisis. El cerebro fue extirpado rpidamente, disecado y cada regin del cerebro fue congelada al instante en hielo seco y almacenada a -80 C para su posterior anlisis. El bazo se retir y se proces inmediatamente despus de los sacrificios para la estimulacin inmune ex vivo. El tejido intestinal (se extirparon segmentos de 2 cm de leon y colon ms cercanos al ciego, y se us el 1 cm de tejido ms alejado del ciego) se montaron en las cmaras Ussing para el ensayo de permeabilidad intestinal. Se retir el ciego, se pes y se almacen a -80 C para el anlisis de SCFA.Animals were sacrificed randomly with respect to treatment and test condition; Sampling was carried out between 9.00 a.m. and 1 p.m. Stem blood was collected in potassium EDTA (ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid) tubes and centrifuged for 15 minutes at 4000 g. Plasma was isolated and stored at -80C for later analysis. The brain was rapidly excised, dissected, and each brain region was snap-frozen on dry ice and stored at -80C for later analysis. The spleen was removed and processed immediately after sacrifices for ex vivo immune stimulation. Intestinal tissue (2 cm segments of ileum and colon closest to the cecum were excised, and the 1 cm of tissue furthest from the cecum used) were mounted in Ussing chambers for intestinal permeability testing. The cecum was removed, weighed and stored at -80C for SCFA analysis.

Anlisis de monoaminasMonoamine analysis

La concentracin de neurotransmisores se analiz por HPLC en muestras del tronco enceflico. Brevemente, el tejido del tronco enceflico se sonic en 500 j l de fase mvil enfriada adicionada con 4 ng/40 j l de N-metil 5-HT (Sigma Chemical Co., Reino Unido) como estndar interno. La fase mvil contena cido ctrico 0,1 M, cido octano-1-sulfnico 5,6 mM (Sigma), dihidrgeno fosfato de sodio 0,1 M, EDTA 0,01 mM (Alkem/Reagecon, Cork) y metanol al 9% (v/v) (Alkem/Reagecon) y se ajust a pH 2,8 usando hidrxido de sodio 4N (Alkem/Reagecon). Luego se centrifugaron los homogeneizados durante 15 minutos a 22.000 x g a 4 C y se inyectaron 40 gl del sobrenadante en el sistema HPLC que consista en un controlador del sistema SCL 10-Avp, un detector electroqumico LECD 6A (Shimadzu), una bomba LC-10AS, un horno CTO-10A, un autoinyector SIL-10A (con enfriador de muestras mantenido a 40 C) y un desgasificador Gastorr en lnea (ISS, Reino Unido). Se emple una columna de fase inversa (Kinetex 2,6 u C18 100 x 4,6 mm, Phenomenex) mantenida a 30 C en la separacin (Caudal 0,9 ml/min). El electrodo de trabajo de carbono vidrioso combinado con un electrodo de referencia Ag/AgCl (Shimdazu) operaba a 0.8 V y los cromatogramas generados se analizaron usando el software Class-VP5 (Shimadzu). Los neurotransmisores se identificaron por sus tiempos de retencin caractersticos de acuerdo con lo determinado por las inyecciones estndar, que se ejecutan a intervalos regulares durante el anlisis de la muestra. Las proporciones de los picos mximos de analito frente al estndar interno se midieron y compararon con la inyeccin estndar. Los resultados se expresaron como ng de neurotransmisor por g de peso fresco de tejido.Neurotransmitter concentration was analyzed by HPLC in brainstem samples. Briefly, brainstem tissue was sonicated in 500 l of chilled mobile phase spiked with 4 ng/40 l of N-methyl 5-HT (Sigma Chemical Co., UK) as internal standard. The mobile phase contained 0.1 M citric acid, 5.6 mM octane-1-sulfonic acid (Sigma), 0.1 M sodium dihydrogen phosphate, 0.01 mM EDTA (Alkem/Reagecon, Cork) and 9% (v/v) methanol (Alkem/Reagecon) and adjusted to pH 2.8 using 4N sodium hydroxide (Alkem/Reagecon). The homogenates were then centrifuged for 15 min at 22,000 xg at 4C and 40 gl of the supernatant was injected into the HPLC system consisting of SCL 10-Avp system controller, LECD 6A electrochemical detector (Shimadzu), LC-pump 10AS, a CTO-10A oven, a SIL-10A autoinjector (with sample cooler maintained at 40 C), and an on-line Gastorr degasser (ISS, UK). A reverse phase column (Kinetex 2.6 u C18 100 x 4.6 mm, Phenomenex) maintained at 30C was used in the separation (Flow rate 0.9 ml/min). The glassy carbon working electrode combined with an Ag/AgCl reference electrode (Shimdazu) operated at 0.8 V and the generated chromatograms were analyzed using Class-VP5 software (Shimadzu). Neurotransmitters were identified by their characteristic retention times as determined by standard injections, which are run at regular intervals during sample analysis. The ratios of the maximum peaks of analyte versus the internal standard were measured and compared to the standard injection. The results were expressed as ng of neurotransmitter per g of fresh tissue weight.

Anlisis de metabolitosMetabolite analysis

Para el anlisis del metabolito GC, se derivatizaron muestras de sobrenadantes bacterianos con cloroformato de metilo usando una versin ligeramente modificada del protocolo descrito en [72]. Todas las muestras fueron analizadas en un orden aleatorio. El anlisis se realiz usando GC (7890B, Agilent) acoplado con un detector de cuadropolos (59977B, Agilent). El sistema fue controlado por ChemStation (Agilent). Los datos brutos se convirtieron al formato netCDF usando Chemstation (Agilent), antes de que los datos se importaran y procesaran en Matlab R2014b (Mathworks, Inc.) usando el software PARADISe descrito en [65].For GC metabolite analysis, bacterial supernatant samples were derivatized with methyl chloroformate using a slightly modified version of the protocol described in [72]. All samples were analyzed in a random order. Analysis was performed using GC (7890B, Agilent) coupled with a quadrupole detector (59977B, Agilent). The system was controlled by ChemStation (Agilent). Raw data was converted to netCDF format using Chemstation (Agilent), before data was imported and processed in Matlab R2014b (Mathworks, Inc.) using PARADISe software described in [65].

Para el anlisis de cidos grasos, las muestras se acidificaron usando cido clorhdrico y se aadieron patrones internos marcados con deuterio. Todas las muestras fueron analizadas en un orden aleatorio. El anlisis se realiz usando una columna de alta polaridad (Columna Zebron ZB-FFAP, GC Cap. 30 m x 0,25 mm x 0,25 gm) instalada en un GC (7890B, Agilent) acoplada con un detector de cuadropolos (59977B, Agilent). El sistema fue controlado por ChemStation (Agilent). Los datos brutos se convirtieron al formato netCDF usando Chemstation (Agilent), antes de que los datos se importaran y procesaran en Matlab R2014b (Mathworks, Inc.) usando el software PARADISe descrito en [65].For fatty acid analysis, samples were acidified using hydrochloric acid and deuterium-labeled internal standards were added. All samples were analyzed in a random order. Analysis was performed using a high polarity column (Zebron ZB-FFAP Column, GC Cap. 30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 gm) installed on a GC (7890B, Agilent) coupled with a quadrupole detector (59977B , Agilent). The system was controlled by ChemStation (Agilent). Raw data was converted to netCDF format using Chemstation (Agilent), before data was imported and processed in Matlab R2014b (Mathworks, Inc.) using PARADISe software described in [65].

Resultados - produccin de neurotransmisoresResults - neurotransmitter production

Los resultados se muestran en la Figura 20, que muestra que en los cerebros de ratones alimentados con MRx0029, los niveles de noradrenalina aumentan (p = 0,0507), acompaados de un ligero aumento de serotonina y 5-HIAA. Estos datos respaldan el anlisis de metabolitos que se expone a continuacin, lo que sugiere que MRx00029 es un importante productor de cido 4-hidroxifenilactico, un antioxidante conocido [73]. Ms importante an, el cido 4-hidroxifenilactico es un producto intermedio sinttico de dopamina y noradrenalina y una importante molcula bioactiva [74]. De hecho, en la EP, los cambios degenerativos se extienden ms all del sistema dopaminrgico, afectando por igual a los sistemas serotoninrgicos y noradrenrgicos, lo que a su vez lleva a niveles disminuidos de serotonina (5-hidroxitriptamina, 5-HT) y noradrenalina (norepinefrina) tanto en el cuerpo estriado como en el extra estructuras estriatales [75]. L-DOPA se dirige principalmente a las caractersticas relacionadas con la dopamina de la EP, sin embargo, no aborda las disminuciones tanto en 5-HT como en noradrenalina. Adems de esto, cuanto ms larga sea la duracin del tratamiento con L-DOPA, ms visibles son un rango de complicaciones motoras y no motoras (por ejemplo, discinesia, sntomas psiquitricos) [76]. Por lo tanto, estos datos demuestran que las bacterias que producen cidos orgnicos, como el cido 4-hidroxifenilactico, pueden ser tiles en la terapia, en particular en el tratamiento de enfermedades neurodegenerativas.The results are shown in Figure 20, which shows that in the brains of mice fed MRx0029, norepinephrine levels are increased (p=0.0507), accompanied by a slight increase in serotonin and 5-HIAA. These data support the metabolite analysis below, suggesting that MRx00029 is an important producer of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, a known antioxidant [73]. More importantly, 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid is a synthetic intermediate of dopamine and norepinephrine and an important bioactive molecule [74]. In fact, in PD, the degenerative changes extend beyond the dopaminergic system, affecting serotonergic and noradrenergic systems alike, which in turn leads to decreased levels of serotonin (5-hydroxytryptamine, 5-HT) and norepinephrine (norepinephrine) both in the striatum and in the extra striatal structures [75]. L-DOPA primarily targets the dopamine-related features of PD, however it does not address decreases in both 5-HT and norepinephrine. In addition to this, the longer the duration of L-DOPA treatment, the more visible are a range of motor and non-motor complications (eg, dyskinesia, psychiatric symptoms) [76]. Therefore, these data demonstrate that bacteria that produce organic acids, such as 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, may be useful in therapy, particularly in the treatment of neurodegenerative diseases.

Resultados - produccin de metabolitosResults - production of metabolites

Los metabolitos presentes en los sobrenadantes de bacterias pueden influir directamente en la respuesta del husped al estrs oxidativo, la comunicacin de clula a clula y la neuroproteccin en el especfico. Se analizaron los metabolitos en el sobrenadante de cultivos de MRX0029 y MRX0005 y los resultados se muestran en la Figura 21.Metabolites present in bacterial supernatants can directly influence the host response to oxidative stress, cell-to-cell communication, and neuroprotection in the specific. The metabolites in the culture supernatant of MRX0029 and MRX0005 were analyzed and the results are shown in Figure 21.

Algunos metabolitos mostraron una notable diferencia entre las dos cepas analizadas. La concentracin de cido succnico fue particularmente elevada en MRx0005. Curiosamente, la proporcin muestra/medio para el cido 4-hidroxifenilactico fue significativamente mayor en MRx0029 (Fig. 21A).Some metabolites showed a remarkable difference between the two strains tested. The concentration of succinic acid was particularly high in MRx0005. Interestingly, the sample/medium ratio for 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid was significantly higher in MRx0029 (FIG. 21A).

El anlisis de cidos grasos en los sobrenadantes revel una dicotoma interesante en las dos cepas: MRx0005 produjo principalmente cido actico y propanoico, mientras que MRx0029 produjo cido butanoico, pentanoico y hexanoico, tanto en forma lineal como ramificada (Fig.21 B). Las dos cepas parecan muy diferentes y, en particular, la produccin de cido succnico y cido 4-hidroxifenilactico por MRx0005 y MRx0029 respectivamente fue notable (Figura 21A). Adems, MRx0005 parece producir ms cidos grasos de cadena corta C2 y C3, mientras que MRx00029 produce ms C4 (butirato) y cidos grasos de cadena media tanto lineal como ramificada, incluyendo el cido hexanoico. Analysis of fatty acids in the supernatants revealed an interesting dichotomy in the two strains: MRx0005 produced mainly acetic and propanoic acid, while MRx0029 produced butanoic, pentanoic, and hexanoic acid, both in linear and branched forms (Fig. 21 B). The two strains appeared very different and, in particular, the production of succinic acid and 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid by MRx0005 and MRx0029 respectively was notable (FIG. 21A). In addition, MRx0005 appears to produce more C2 and C3 short chain fatty acids, while MRx00029 produces more C4 (butyrate) and both straight and branched medium chain fatty acids, including hexanoic acid.

El cido succnico es un metabolito del ciclo de Krebs implicado en la fosforilacin oxidativa. El complejo de fosforilacin oxidativa es un paso clave para el trfico sinptico de protenas y vesculas a las regiones proximales y distales [77]. Se ha informado de su disfuncin en trastornos neurodegenerativos, incluyendo la enfermedad de Alzheimer, la enfermedad de Parkinson y la ataxia espinocerebelosa tipo 1 [78]. Estos descubrimientos son particularmente interesantes ya que el cido succnico puede aumentar la actividad mitocondrial y apoyar a las neuronas vulnerables en enfermedades neurodegenerativas relacionadas con protenas mal plegadas, incluida la EP [79]. El BDNF y el cido succnico tienen ambos una actividad protectora similar no solo en la neurodegeneracin sino tambin en trastornos mentales como la depresin y la ansiedad, que son bastante comunes entre los pacientes diagnosticados con EP o EA.Succinic acid is a Krebs cycle metabolite involved in oxidative phosphorylation. The oxidative phosphorylation complex is a key step for synaptic trafficking of proteins and vesicles to proximal and distal regions [77]. Its dysfunction has been reported in neurodegenerative disorders, including Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, and spinocerebellar ataxia type 1 [78]. These findings are particularly interesting as succinic acid can increase mitochondrial activity and support vulnerable neurons in misfolded protein-related neurodegenerative diseases, including PD [79]. BDNF and succinic acid both have similar protective activity not only in neurodegeneration but also in mental disorders such as depression and anxiety, which are quite common among patients diagnosed with PD or AD.

La Figura 21B tambin demuestra que MRX0029 es un productor de butirato (cido butanoico). Esto puede ser significativo porque el butirato tiene una funcin conocida que es reducir la impermeabilidad de la barrera hematoenceflica, lo que tiene un efecto neuroprotector [80]. Esta propiedad de MRx0029 (y otras bacterias neuroprotectoras) puede contribuir a su eficacia.Figure 21B also demonstrates that MRX0029 is a producer of butyrate (butanoic acid). This may be significant because butyrate has a known function to reduce the impermeability of the blood-brain barrier, which has a neuroprotective effect [80]. This property of MRx0029 (and other neuroprotective bacteria) may contribute to its efficacy.

Ejemplo 16 - Modulacin de la expresin de ARNm de protenas de unin estrecha por MRx0029Example 16 - Modulation of tight junction protein mRNA expression by MRx0029

Como la evidencia reciente sugiere que la disfuncin intestinal y la inflamacin es un sntoma no motor asociado con la EP, se investig la capacidad de las cepas bacterianas de la invencin de provocar cualquier disfuncin de la barrera intestinal. Las monocapas celulares epiteliales HT29-mtx productoras de mucina [81] se utilizaron como modelo in vitro para evaluar la alteracin de la barrera intestinal y la estimulacin inmune despus del tratamiento con MRx0005 y MRx0029. Las clulas HT29-mtx diferenciadas expuestas a forbol 12-miristato-13-acetato (PMA) secretaron una cantidad significativa de IL-8; por el contrario, el tratamiento durante 24 h con sobrenadantes bacterianos MRx005 y MRx0029, indujo una secrecin an ms baja de IL-8 en comparacin con las clulas no tratadas y tratadas con YCFA (Fig. 22A).As recent evidence suggests that intestinal dysfunction and inflammation is a non-motor symptom associated with PD, the ability of the bacterial strains of the invention to cause any intestinal barrier dysfunction was investigated. Mucin-producing HT29-mtx epithelial cell monolayers [81] were used as an in vitro model to assess intestinal barrier disruption and immune stimulation after treatment with MRx0005 and MRx0029. Differentiated HT29-mtx cells exposed to phorbol 12-myristate-13-acetate (PMA) secreted a significant amount of IL-8; in contrast, treatment for 24 h with bacterial supernatants MRx005 and MRx0029 induced even lower secretion of IL-8 compared to untreated and YCFA-treated cells (FIG. 22A).

Luego se investig la capacidad de MRx0005 y MRx0029 para regular la permeabilidad epitelial modificando la transduccin de seales intracelulares implicada en la expresin y localizacin de protenas implicadas en la formacin de barrera intestinal.The ability of MRx0005 and MRx0029 to regulate epithelial permeability by modifying intracellular signal transduction involved in the expression and localization of proteins involved in intestinal barrier formation was then investigated.

Se aisl el ARN y se realiz un anlisis cuantitativo de RT-PCR (qRT-PCR) para caracterizar los cambios en la expresin gnica de protenas de unin estrecha durante la incubacin con MRx0005 y MRx0029. La administracin de MRx0029 mejor la expresin de ARNm de Occludina, Villina, Tight Protena de unin Estrecha 1 y 2 (respectivamente TJP1 y TJP2) despus de 2 h de incubacin (Fig. 22B). Por el contrario, la exposicin a MRx0005 no alter la expresin gnica de las protenas de unin estrecha, lo que indica que las dos cepas actan de manera diferencial en la barrera intestinal.RNA was isolated and quantitative RT-PCR (qRT-PCR) analysis was performed to characterize changes in gene expression of tight junction proteins during incubation with MRx0005 and MRx0029. Administration of MRx0029 enhanced mRNA expression of Occludin, Villin, Tight Junction Protein 1 and 2 (respectively TJP1 and TJP2) after 2 h incubation (FIG. 22B). In contrast, exposure to MRx0005 did not alter gene expression of tight junction proteins, indicating that the two strains act differentially at the intestinal barrier.

Los resultados in vitro se compararon con los datos del anlisis paralelo ex vivo en el intestino de ratones alimentados con MRx0005 y MRx0029. La expresin gnica de TJP2 y occludina se cuantific en el colon y el leon. Los datos ex vivo reflejan perfectamente los datos in vitro ya que MRx0029 pudo regular significativamente TJP1 y Occludina (p = 0,073) en la regin del colon del intestino murino (Fig. 22C+22D). MRx0029 tambin fue capaz de disminuir la funcin de permeabilidad en el colon de los mismos ratones (Fig. 22E+22F).The in vitro results were compared with data from the parallel ex vivo analysis in the intestine of mice fed MRx0005 and MRx0029. Gene expression of TJP2 and occludin was quantified in the colon and ileum. The ex vivo data perfectly mirrors the in vitro data as MRx0029 was able to significantly upregulate TJP1 and Occludin (p=0.073) in the colon region of the murine intestine (Fig. 22C+22D). MRx0029 was also able to decrease permeability function in the colon of the same mice (FIG. 22E+22F).

Materiales y mtodos - extraccin de ARN y anlisis de qPCRMaterials and methods - RNA extraction and qPCR analysis

El ARN total se extrajo usando el RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen, Manchester, Reino Unido) de acuerdo con las instrucciones del fabricante, y la concentracin de ARN se determin por absorbancia a 260/280 nm usando un espectrofotmetro (nano-Drop ND-1000; Thermo Scientific, Wilmington, DE). Para el anlisis de expresin de ARNm, se prepar ADNc a partir de ARN total usando el kit de transcripcin inversa de ADNc de alta capacidad (Applied Biosystems, Reino Unido) de acuerdo con las instrucciones del fabricante. Las reacciones de transcripcin inversa se realizaron en un termociclador (Biometra, Alemania) a 25 C durante 10 min, 37 C durante 120 min y 85 C durante 5 min, mantenido a 4 C. El ADNc resultante se amplific por duplicado mediante el ensayo SYBR-Green PCR, y los productos se detectaron en la mquina de PCR en tiempo real QuantStudio 6 flex (Applied Biosystems, Reino Unido) usando un perfil estandarizado (desnaturalizacin inicial de 95 C durante 10 minutos, seguida de 40 ciclos de 15 segundos de desnaturalizacin a 95 C y 60 segundos de apareamiento/extensin a 60/65 C, dependiendo de los cebadores. Se aadi una etapa de disociacin despus de 40 ciclos para generar una curva de fusin. El anlisis se realiz usando el software de PCR en tiempo real de Applied Biosystems QuantStudio v1.2. Las secuencias de cebadores para Actina, Villina, Occludina TJP1 y TJP2 se proporcionan en el listado de secuencias.Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen, Manchester, UK) according to the manufacturer's instructions, and RNA concentration was determined by absorbance at 260/280 nm using a spectrophotometer (nano-Drop ND-1000 ; Thermo Scientific, Wilmington, DE). For mRNA expression analysis, cDNA was prepared from total RNA using the High Capacity cDNA Reverse Transcription Kit (Applied Biosystems, UK) according to the manufacturer's instructions. Reverse transcription reactions were performed in a thermocycler (Biometra, Germany) at 25C for 10 min, 37C for 120 min, and 85C for 5 min, kept at 4C. The resulting cDNA was amplified in duplicate. using the SYBR-Green PCR assay, and products were detected on the QuantStudio 6 flex real-time PCR machine (Applied Biosystems, UK) using a standardized profile (initial denaturation at 95C for 10 minutes, followed by 40 cycles 15 seconds denaturation at 95C and 60 seconds annealing/extension at 60/65C, depending on the primers. A cleavage step was added after 40 cycles to generate a melting curve. Analysis was performed using Applied Biosystems QuantStudio real-time PCR software v1.2 The primer sequences for Actin, Villin, Occludin TJP1 and TJP2 are provided in the sequence listing.

Ejemplo 16 - Prueba de estabilidadExample 16 - Stability test

Una composicin descrita en la presente que contiene por lo menos una cepa bacteriana descrita en la presente se almacena en un recipiente sellado a 25 C o 4 C y el recipiente se coloca en una atmsfera que tiene un 30%, 40%, 50%, 60%, 70%, 75%, 80%, 90% o 95% de humedad relativa. Despus de 1 mes, 2 meses, 3 meses, 6 meses, 1 ao, 1,5 aos, 2 aos, 2,5 aos o 3 aos, por lo menos un 50%, 60%, 70% o, 80% o 90% de la cepa bacteriana permanecer medida en unidades formadoras de colonias determinadas por protocolos estndar.A composition described herein containing at least one bacterial strain described herein is stored in a sealed container at 25C or 4C and the container is placed in an atmosphere that is 30%, 40%, 50% %, 60%, 70%, 75%, 80%, 90% or 95% relative humidity. After 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 1.5 years, 2 years, 2.5 years, or 3 years, at least 50%, 60%, 70%, or 80% or 90% of the strain Bacterial bacteria will remain measured in colony-forming units determined by standard protocols.

Ejemplo 17Example 17

MtodosMethods

AnimalesAnimals

Los animales y el diseo del estudio usados fueron los mismos que para el Ejemplo 15.The animals and study design used were the same as for Example 15.

Cepas bacterianasbacterial strains

755: Parabacteroides distasonis (MRX005) 755: Parabacteroides distasonis (MRX005)

Megasphaera massiliensis (MRX0029) Megasphaera massiliensis (MRX0029)

Recogida de tejidostissue collection

Los animales fueron sacrificados de manera aleatoria con respecto al tratamiento y la condicin de prueba; el muestreo se realiz entre las 9.00 a.m. y las 2.30 p.m. Se recogi sangre troncal en tubos de EDTA (cido etilendiaminotetraactico) de potasio y se centrifug durante 15 minutos a 4000 g. El plasma se aisl y se almacen a -80 C para su posterior anlisis. El cerebro se extirp rpidamente, se diseccion y cada regin del cerebro se congel al instante en hielo seco y se almacen a -80 C para su posterior anlisis.
